intro: Castilleja scabrida var. scabrida, commonly known as the scabrous milkvetch, is a hemiparasitic plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and has a unique root system that allows it to parasitize the roots of other plants. The plant is characterized by its bright red to orange flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are usually small, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Castilleja scabrida var. scabrida is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges.
